★★★★☆ Very Good!

[h1]Teamwork[/h1]

Killing Floor takes everything you expect from cliche shooters and turns it on its head - in a good way. When a game features selectable classes, a ranking system, DLC and buying weapons, most people think they have the gameplay all figured out - and they are completely wrong.

Unlike most class-based shooters, Killing Floor does not offer unique weapons for each class (called "Perks"). Instead, each perk offers an advantage with certain weapon types and certain overall abilities (such as accuracy/reload speed bonuses, headshot damage multipliers, speed boosts etc.), while allowing every perk to use every weapon and item in the game (for the correct price, of course). This affects the game in many ways. Firstly, players are able to make hybrid loadouts, and new perk/weapon combinations which were originally not intended but are very effective can be used. For example, the Lever Action Rifle is a sharpshooter perk weapon, however this weapon is great in the hands of a medic because of his speed bonus while moving. By not enforcing specific player models on a perk by perk basis, the game manages to allow player customisability and yet allow easy perk identification through icons above players heads and in the scoreboard.

The game is also quite punishing, although it seems completely fair when a player dies. If you don't plan ahead with the rest of the team, you are likely to lose, especially on the harder difficulties. It is even possible to die on the first wave (which is usually a free money easymode wave) by allowing yourself to be surrounded.

The enemies are also very well thought out. Each enemy type has its own unique ability, such as the clots ability to grab and hold a player (preventing them from moving), which makes them extremely deadly in large groups or when up close.

Killing Floor also features an amazing ranking system, which manages to avoid many of the problems inherent in traditional ranking systems. Each perk is ranked up individually, which means the player will never achieve a new rank only to unlock a higher level for a perk they never use. It also gives every player, from the day 1 noob to the hardcore veteran, access to all of the game content immediately. Instead of unlocking new weapons or abilities, ranking up simply makes the perks more effective, which keeps the game balanced, and doesn't enforce an artificial divide between skilled players and newer players based on unlocks

And now, the mandatory L4D comparison paragraph. The game has some similarities to L4D cause creators were inspired by Left 4 Dead, but is definitely a different game. Many reviewers compare the 2, which is impossible because of their differing natures. While L4D is about completing goals and making it to the end of the map, Killing Floor is all about surviving, planning ahead, getting a good class balance within the squad, and making sure everyone has access to the limited resources available.

To make a great game truly legendary, Tripwire have been constantly updating Killing Floor and releasing free content and weapon packs, including community maps, and have a system in place to whitelist custom maps and mutators (small server-side mods) to allow people to use and level up their perks.

If you're a skilled player you can survive on your own in most situations, instead of getting pinned down by a hunter/smoker the second your other team mates die. Just buy it and play it for a few days and judge for yourself.

It's a great game for friends, or even by yourself if you want to kill monster LIKE A BAWSE.
youve def got to get it the most awsome game ever

Simple premise.  Superb gameplay. Instant gratification.  Killing Floor is basically a co-op team shooter where you and up to 5 total strangers join forces to exterminate up to 10 waves of increasingly difficult zombie-esque enemies.  

A wide range of maps, a large collection of weapons and numerous class styles with their own unique damage bonuses provides a humungous range of replayability, even if the action is essentially repetitive.  Different levels of difficult allow players of any ability to join up and kick the .... out of the enemy forces, while trying to compliment their range of skills to overcome the latest challenges.  

While I dont really enjoy or play many online games and very rarely those that do not have a campaign game, this took me by surprise and has already seen me notch up 330+ hours in a few weeks. 

Very addictive.  Surprisingly never gets stale.  If you love your shooters and killing zombie targets - this one is better than L4D imo.
Come on and join me guys XD
ce jeux est très bien pas chere et genial je vous le conseil vivement !! :D

This game replaced TF2 in my library for a team-based FPS when hats got too crazy. The game itself is challenging, and humourous in dialogue. Teamwork is more important in this game than in many other team-based FPS. The perk system rewards continuous play by making you more powerful over the entire time you play.

This game is definitely worth the 'Dosh'!

This game is not bad i like it although It does get repetitive after a while. the music is great if you love metal. I recommend this game especially with friends.

Guns, guts, guvs, and plenty of slow motion carnage. What more could you ask for?

This game seriously surprised me. When I first bought it, it received a quick meh as I started solo play and even a few online games. I didn't quite enjoy it. But then I gave it another chance this summer, and I am glad I did. It has a lvl up perks system which gives you better handling of your perk weapons and better prices (you buy your weapons after each wave), as well as more power. You play through waves of specimen, all trying to kill you and your squad. The maps are fantastic, and much like l4d, there are custom created maps and modified servers with different gamemodes to play on too.

Just remember: this is a co-op game. You cannot benefit playing solo. You must play with live players to enjoy it. Also, don't play the harder difficulties as a newbie. Playing normal on a lvl 0 perk is like playing hard mode or harder. Join the Suicidal and Hell on Earth difficulties after your perks have been lvled up to 5 or 6, 6 being the highest lvl in the game. Just some fellow advice. :)

Pretty good game to play if you're just wanting to have a fun time with your mates. With lost of weapons to choose from, and different perks to match. Plenty of levels to play depending on how you feel, from the Clastrophobic "Biotics Lab", to the wide, dark, and open "Farm" I recommend this game for both expirenced and inexpirenced First Person Shooter Players. Definitely worth the buy.

This game is fast-paced, difficult at times, and brutal when you are new. When you learn how to play after a few games, it becomes some of the most fun zombie-killing moments you will have on your PC. There are a stunning amount of guns to buy and choose from in-game. Each one is different and varies in utility. There are 7 classes to choose from, each is better with a different kind of weapon, and you can lvl each class up to 6.

This game is the most fun to play on servers with your friends. I would reccommend starting out on West  London and make your way into Biotics Lab, Mansion, and then other levels at your discretion. =) Make sure you are using the right weapons for your class to ensure the most damage against the enemy. You're gonna get hounded from the minute you enter the game....so either keep moving and stick together, or find a place to hole up with your friends and stick out the storm. If you try and play alone early on, you're going to lose. It's difficult, but it's the kind of difficulty that makes you want to keep playing and get better.

My advice is once you've played enough, find a server with some fun mods that will switch up your gameplay experience. Modders make the Killing Floor community what it still is today! There is a WIDE variety of downloadables from the Steam Workshop, so be sure to check them out! =)

I personally reccommend the "Guardian Knight" modded servers. Keep a good lookout for them. They boast a LARGE amount of Perk mods (Terminator, Sentry, Swordmaster, Sniper, Stormtrooper, Mage, Juggernaut, Doom/Quake Marine, just to name a few) ...and you'll end up fighting some of the worst nightmares you've ever fought in an FPS. The modded-out zeds are thirsty for your blood and they're GOING to get you. Get good and get them back. ;D

All in all, this game is a ton of fun, and it will keep you coming back to kill zombies for hours upon hours....take it from me, I've played the game for 4 years now and have about 1000 hours put into this monstrosity. Check it out, and prepare yourselves for KILLING FLOOR 2, coming soon!!!!!
This game is a must have!
pew pew
This game is just pure brutal fun. A must have for any survival horror fans. It's better than Call of Duty Zombies!!!

A well balanced, fun, and intense zombie survival shooter. The upgradable classes mean you're rewarded for playing more, and each round starts off fresh so it's easy to roll back into the game after a break. Teams of six and less make for interesting squad dynamics and the in-game voice chat works quite well. Combined with seemingly endless custom maps, a few custom zombies, and generally fun community, I would highly recommend this game.

Хардкорная игра, особенно на высоких уровнях сложности, но уж слишком много багов. Монстры часто застревали, урон распределялся неправильно. Порой бывало такое, что после убийства Патриарха игра просто зависала и не зачисляла победу, а на самом высоком уровне сложности его довольно таки сложно победить не скооперировавшись. Это адски выбешивало и расстраивало. 
С этой игрой у меня связано очень много теплых воспоминаний, особенно когда играли вместе с друзьями. Разработчики игру не забрасывали, и каждый праздничный сезон (лето, Хэллоуин, Рождество) устраивали эвенты, добавляли новый контент.
Увы, покупать ее не советую, бериту вторую часть.
Отличная игра, хоть я и не любитель зомби. Одна из любимых сетевых игр.

Very simple plot; kill zombies to earn money to buy guns to kill more zombies! The presentation is about as simple too, you certainly don't buy this game for stunning graphics!  What makes is special is it's playability, it's just great fun! And it's one of the very few coop games around that consistently attracts a huge number of players. Far better than the critics would have you believe. Just buy it!!

Killing Floor it is good game, main focus is survive waves of flesh eating monsters with another 5 players, the weapons are well done with nice effects and are very fun to use.There are 7 perks to use, each one with specific effects, leveling up grant better effects.The lack of aim cross make the gameplay even better, adding difficult to the combat.In my personal opinion the only bad thing about killing floor is the DLC weapons.
This is my favorate 1st person zombie shooter, because it always runs smooth, game is very fun, also has a good leveling system to keep you comming back for more, even after years to come! A+++ 9/10
